Demonstrates how to create a C++/CLI library using the VideoXpert SDK

MediaControl.cpp
1 #include "MediaControl.h"
5 
6 using namespace System::Runtime::InteropServices;
7 
8 CPPCli::MediaControl::MediaControl(DataSource^ dataSource, DataInterface::StreamProtocols protocol) {
9  MediaController::MediaRequest request;
10  request.dataSource = dataSource->_dataSource;
11  request.protocol = VxSdk::VxStreamProtocol::Value(protocol);
12 
13  MediaController::IController* control = nullptr;
14  MediaController::GetController(&request, &control);
15 
16  _timestampCallback = gcnew TimestampCallbackDelegate(this, &CPPCli::MediaControl::_FireTimestampEvent);
17  control->AddObserver(MediaController::TimestampEventCallback(Marshal::GetFunctionPointerForDelegate(_timestampCallback).ToPointer()));
18 
19  _control = control;
20 }
21 
22 void CPPCli::MediaControl::SetVideoWindow(System::IntPtr windowHandle) {
23  void* VideoWindow = windowHandle.ToPointer();
24  _control->SetWindow(VideoWindow);
25 }
26 
27 void CPPCli::MediaControl::SetDataSource(DataSource^ dataSource, DataInterface::StreamProtocols protocol) {
28  MediaController::MediaRequest request;
29  request.dataSource = dataSource->_dataSource;
30  request.protocol = VxSdk::VxStreamProtocol::Value(protocol);
31  _control->NewRequest(request);
32 }
33 
34 CPPCli::MediaControl::!MediaControl() {
35  _control->ClearObservers();
36  delete _control;
37 }

40  _control->Play(speed);
41 }

44  _control->Pause();
45 }

53 }

55 void CPPCli::MediaControl::Seek(System::DateTime time, int speed) {
56  System::TimeSpan ts = (time - System::DateTime(1970, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0));
57  unsigned int seekTime = safe_cast<unsigned int>(ts.TotalSeconds);
58  _control->Seek(seekTime, speed);
59 }
60 
61 void CPPCli::MediaControl::TimestampEvent::add(TimestampEventDelegate ^eventDelegate) {
62  _timestampEvent += eventDelegate;
63 };
64 
65 void CPPCli::MediaControl::TimestampEvent::remove(TimestampEventDelegate ^eventDelegate) {
66  _timestampEvent -= eventDelegate;
67 };
68 
69 void CPPCli::MediaControl::_FireTimestampEvent(MediaController::TimestampEvent* timeEvent) {
70  if (_timestampEvent != nullptr)
71  return _timestampEvent(gcnew MediaEvent(timeEvent));
72 }
